media:group.media:title: Armeniaโs sole nuclear power plant suspends operation for two months
media:group.media:description:
๐ In a years-long trial, a man named Ara Badoyan was sentenced to three and a half years in prison for his role in the 2020 assault on Ararat Mirzoyan, Armeniaโs parliamentary speaker at the time. ๐ Armenia and Azerbaijan could potentially join the Abraham Accords, a U.S.-brokered initiative aimed at normalizing ties between Israel and Muslim-majority countries, Donald Trumpโs special representative, Steve Witkoff, said. ๐ Armeniaโs Metsamor Nuclear Power Plant will suspend operations for two months starting tomorrow for scheduled maintenance, its lifespan set to end in 2036. Infrastructure Minister David Khudatyan said a preliminary project for the new nuclear plant will be ready by the end of this year.

entry.title: Closing the gaps in Armeniaโs cancer care

media:group.media:title: Closing the gaps in Armeniaโs cancer care
media:group.media:description:
Global health advocate Pat Garcia-Gonzalez, CEO of The Max Foundation, sits down with CivilNet to reflect on two decades of work in Armenia, highlighting the countryโs significant progress in cancer care alongside the critical gaps that persist. She explains how with better education for patient advocacy, reduced stigma, and expanded government health coverage for diagnostics and medication, Armenia can achieve cancer survival rates on par with the worldโs most advanced healthcare systems.
0:00- The Max Foundationโs mission in Armenia 2:22- Improvements in cancer care over the past two decades 4:00- Increasing access to cancer medications 5:56- Future focuses for improving cancer care 8:36- Breaking stigmas around cancer and bringing hope
